chapter.title: Notes

section.title: External dependencies
section.para: This section lists some things that are kind of ugly in the sense that the application may not work perfectly if some external parameters are changed.

In SHARED_CONSTANTS:
Plane_size is a constant that is chosen with the example maps in mind. This works for them but it might not work perfectly for other map files.
map_to_gl_coords is also optimized for our example maps. It uses the range of the coordinates from the map xml file and centers the Zurich main station on the screen. This might not be intended for other examples.
These issues could be solved by either extending the map file or using a separate xml file.

chapter.section:
Reutilisation and extensions
This section discusses some scenarios of how one could reuse this work.
1) Replacing the GUI:
One could replace the GUI with another one or integrate the 'map part' (i.e. MAP and the factories) of the project into another application. This could be done by creating an instance of MAP in the new application and accessing the features from the option section with the widgets of the new GUI simillary to how this is done in CITY_3D_SCENE or even add new features to MAP.
2) Extending displayed objects:
One could add new factories to the project or use existing ones to display more and different buildings, traffic lines or anything else. The easiest way to create a new factory would be to inherit from EM_3D_OBJECT_FACTORY as this is done with the two implemented factories. With BUILDING_FACTORY reuse comes naturally as it is able to draw any building of choice (how this is done is explained in the corresponding section in classes). If you would like to change the way traffic lines are displayed, you could change specify_object in TRAFFIC_LINE_FACTORY.
3) Extending functionality:
To provide additonal options and functionallity, one would have to add the new features in MAP in the section options and make them accessible by adding corresponding widgets to CITY_3D_SCENE or any other GUI. Then one would have to add the new option to draw like this is done with all the other options.

section.title: Ideas
section.para: This section lists some things one could do in the future to inprove or enhance what we have done so far.

1) New features:
Promenade through the city: would make it possible to walk through the city with some character and to explore the city 'per pedes'.
Extra XML file: that would contain additional information like the position of special buildings, their textures, height, etc. Moreover, things like the transformation that have to be done in map_to_gl_coords could be stored in this file.

2) Extensions:
Text console or other GUI extensions like they're used in the already existing Traffic applications. But as mentioned above, abolishing CITY_3D_SCENE and taking the rest would probably be the more reasonable way.
Time tables for the means of transport: This would comprise automatic updating or requesting from the internet.
Integration of events like concerts, cinemas, theaters etc.

3) Improvements:
Faster parsing of the XML file as this is one of the main bottlenecks of the project. If the parsing would go faster, more information could be stored and used from the xml file. Otherwise, this project won't 'scale', because adding new features that would go with extending the xml file would make the whole application unreasonably slow.
An other way to bypass this would be to add multithreading. This would make it possible to do the parsing in the background while the user could still interact with the program or parts of the map could already be displayed.
more buildings etc. - would probably need an extra XML file
